chapter.title: Supported Systems
chapter.subtitle: Supported UNIX-like OSes
chapter.para: OpenNMS is written almost entirely in Java, and should be able to run on any system that supports the Sun Java Virtual Machine (Java 1.4 for OpenNMS 1.2.x, Java 5 or 6 for OpenNMS 1.3.x). There are requirements for other programs such as PostgreSQL, Perl, and (for OpenNMS 1.2.x) Tomcat 4 and RRDTool, but the JDK is the key requirement as most of the other packages can be compiled from source.
The following are the systems that support or are known to run OpenNMS.
Windows 2000/XP/Vista are to be supported with 1.3.8.

section.title: Fully Supported
section.para: The following Linux distributions and other Unix-like systems are supported out-of-the-box with native installation packages.
section.bridgehead: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5
Fedora Core 4, Fedora Core 5, Fedora Core 6, Fedora Core 7 and Fedora Core 8 (including 64 bit).

formalpara.title: Debian and Ubuntu
formalpara.para: Debian stable (1.2.x) packages (for Sarge and later) are available at the following apt-repository: deb http://debian.opennms.org/ stable main. Debian unstable (1.3.x) packages (for Etch and later) are available at the following apt-repository: deb http://debian.opennms.org/ unstable main. For more instructions see this How-To written by Ian MacDonald.

These same packages and apt-repositories should work equally well with recent Ubuntu releases. The unstable (1.3.x) packages in particular are tested to work with Ubuntu releases 6.10 (Edgy Eft) and 7.04 (Feisty Fawn). The lack of a sun-java5-jdk package in any official repository for LTS release 6.06 (Dapper Drake) disqualifies this release as a viable target for official OpenNMS packages.

formalpara.title: MacOSX 10.4 (Tiger), 10.5 (Leopard)
formalpara.para: On MacOSX, the Fink distribution packages of OpenNMS are supported. See the Fink web site for more information on installing and using Fink.

section.para: Also note that on MacOSX, PostgreSQL must be configured in the same manner as above for Linux. However, to do so you will need to update the SHM settings so that the OS allows enough resources for PostgreSQL to run with larger buffers.
There are details for configuring the shared memory segments on the Fink wiki.

section.title: Officially Unsupported
section.para: OpenNMS 1.3.7 requires Java 5 (a 1.5 JDK), RRDTool 1.2 (for optional features), and PostgreSQL 7.4, 8.1, or 8.2. Any operating system that can support these dependencies should be able to run OpenNMS. However, since many older distributions do not support packages for these applications it will be much harder to get them installed, and so they are not officially supported.
A number of distributions that used to be supported are still able to run OpenNMS but are not officially supported:

formalpara.title: Mandrake
formalpara.para: OpenNMS should run on Mandrake, and official Mandriva support is expected for OpenNMS 2.0.

formalpara.title: Gentoo
formalpara.para: Information on Gentoo support can be found at http://gentoo.opennms.org.
